Definition of variables: High yielding trait varieties (1 = if the respondent agrees this trait is important, 0 otherwise)
Good adaptation trait varieties (1 = if the respondent agrees this trait is important, 0 otherwise)
High straw yield trait varieties (1 = if the respondent agrees this trait is important, 0 otherwise)
Disease resistance trait varieties (1 = if the respondent agrees this trait is important, 0 otherwise)
Bold grain trait varieties (1 = if the respondent agrees this trait is important, 0 otherwise)
Good taste & cooking quality trait varieties (1 = if the respondent agrees this trait is important, 0 otherwise)
Gender of the head of the household (1 = male head, zero otherwise)
Age of the respondent in the household (in years)
Education level of the respondent (years of schooling)
Household size: total of all household members who live and share meals together in the household (persons)
Total size of agricultural land cultivated by the household in hectares (ha)
Tropical livestock unit (TLU) is used to normalize number of livestock to the equivalent of a cow whereby, cow = 1, sheep = 0.1, goat = 0.08, donkey = 0.5 respectively
Asset index calculated from twelve types of different assets owned by the household (index)
Dummy variable. Self-reported = 1 if the household owned a mobile phone, 0 otherwise.
Dummy variable (1 = if the respondent indicated that he has cultivated improved wheat verities at least once in the past five years, 0 otherwise

Variables: Number of social networks in the village
Definition of variables: The number of people (network) that the respondent has in the village that he can count on for help (in persons)
Dummy variable (1 = if the respondent had any contact with government extension agents, 0 otherwise)
Dummy variable (1 = if the respondent is a member of farmers’ group, 0 otherwise)

Variables: Member of savings and credit group
Definition of variables: Dummy variable (1 = self-reported ability to access credit finance or savings for any purpose including farming whenever needed by the respondent, 0 otherwise.
Dummy variable (1 = if the respondent is a member of Eddir, 0 otherwise)
Dummy variable (1 = if the respondent is a member of Equb, 0 otherwise)
Total amount of rainfall that the household received in the lagged year prior to the survey year (mm/year)

Rainfall shock (index) that the household experiences. This is calculated by taking the absolute value of the difference between total rainfall of the growing season and the historical average of the 21 years rainfall divided by the standard deviation of rainfall in the 21 years period (Equation (3)
Dummy variable (1 = if the household is in rainfall surplus area, 0 otherwise)
Dummy variable (1 = if the household is in Oromia region, 0 otherwise)
Dummy variable (1 = if the household is in Amhara region, 0 otherwise)
Dummy variable (1 = if the household is in SNNP region, 0 otherwise)
